headline: ChatGPT's Ancestor Was Written in 1943 — Before TV Was Common
body: Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts published a paper in 1943 describing a mathematical model of a neuron. No computer could run it. No one funded it. It sat in obscurity for decades. That paper is the direct ancestor of every neural network running today.
timeline: 1943 paper → 1956 AI named → 1986 backpropagation → 2012 deep learning → 2022 ChatGPT. 79 years from concept to product.
